titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I motored to Burwarton, and there lunched with the Rector, M
Parker, with whom was Lilley. After lunch we motored to Chetton, where we were met at the parish church by the vicar, M

Southwell. With this man I had grave talk, for not only has been bankrupt twice over, but he is ill–reported of in the neighbourhood. I told him of his ill repute, & warned him that, if he did not reform his ways, I would certainly take action. He took all this very meekly, a circumstance which assured me of the truth of the evil rumours about him. After visiting Glazeley, we returned to Burwarton & had tea. Then we motored back to Hereford, where I went through my letters with Wynne–Willson. Mainly a wasted day!
